Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: In the part of probability theory, the random events and properties of classical probability are considered. The course covers the theory of random variables and their distributions. In the part of mathematical statistics, the course covers basics of the statistical inference. First, a point estimator, its properties, and methods for finding it are considered. Also, the interval estimation and testing of statistical hypotheses are treated.
description.et: Tõenäosusteooria osas tutvutakse tõenäosusteooria meetoditega ja õpitakse tundma klassikalisi tõenäosusjaotusi. Matemaatilise statistika osa käsitleb statistilise hindamisülesande aluseid. Vaadeldakse punkthinnangut, hinnangu leidmise meetodeid ja omadusi. Seejärel vaadeldakse vahemikhinnangut ja statistiliste hüpoteeside kontrolli.

objectives.en: To give knowledge and experience in probability and statistics, which enables to attend higher level courses on stochastic modelling in master studies.
objectives.et: Anda üliõpilastele teadmised ja oskused tõenäosusteoorias ja matemaatilises statistikas, mis võimaldavad magistriõppes läbida kõrgema taseme kursusi stohhastilise modelleerimise alal.

independent_work.et: There will be given 2 homeworks during the course (details are in Moodle).

description.et: Test will be graded on a scale of 20 total points. You need to have a minimum of 10 points to pass the test.
Up to 5 points for every homework, 10 points in total.
Written exam will be graded on a scale of 40 total points. You need to have a minimum of 20 points to pass the exam.

grade_preconditions.et:
One written tests during the term. The test will be graded on a scale of 20 total points. You need to have a minimum of 10 points to pass the test.

If a student is ill (and therefore misses the test or retake), a doctor's note should be presented within a week to be eligible for another retake opportunity.

grade_evaluation.et:
If the test and the exam have been passed, then the final grade will be calculated as follows: the points of test (max 20p), homework (max 10p), exam (max 40p) are summed together and the grades are:

A: 91-100%
B: 81-90%
C: 71-80%
D: 61-70%
E: 51-60%
F: 0-50%

Points from voluntary assignments (max 5p) will be added to final result.
If the test isn't passed, there's no possibility to take the exam and the final grade is F. There is an opportunity to retake a test if the first try should fail.

There is no possibility to retake a test to improve results.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
G. Blom. Probability and Statistics. Theory and Applications. Springer Verlag, 1989.
G. R. Grimmett, D. R. Stirzaker. Probability and Random Processes. Oxford University Press, 1993.
resources.recommended_materials:
D. Williams. Probability with Martingales. Cambridge University press, 1991.
R. Durrett. Probability: theory and examples. Duxbury Press, 1996.

description.et: Statistical inference. Population and sample. Estimation function. Properties of estimators.
Methods for deriving estimates (the maximum likelihood, least-squares methods and the method of moments).
Confidence interval for the mean. Chi-square distribution, Student's t-distribution.
Confidence interval for the standard deviation and for difference.
Hypothesis testing: power function, independent samples, paired samples.
Hypothesis testing: chi-square test, F-test, p-value method, testing with confidence intervals.
Types of data, measures of dependence.

audience.et: Basic knowledge of calculus (limits, derivative, intergral), algebra and probability theory.
